summary: Patient A received a prescription package intended for Patient B. Patient Bs name, address, and type of medication was compromised. Patient A reported the incident to the medical center and a replacement has been requested for Patient B. The Great Lakes Consolidated Mail Outpatient Pharmacy (CMOP) investigation concludes that this is the result of a VAMC incorrect address transmission leading to a USPS mis-delivery, not a CMOP packaging error. The medical center has been notified.

victim.victim_id: United States Department of Veterans Affairs
